title: How to Set Up Out of Office in Outlook: The Complete Guide

steps.title: Click the File menu at the top-left corner of Outlook.
steps.content: Click the File menu at the top-left corner of Outlook. This expands a larger menu that takes up much of the window. If you're using New Outlook, see this method instead.

steps.title: Click Automatic Replies.
steps.content: Click Automatic Replies . You'll see this button on the left side of the window in most versions of Outlook. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't see an Automatic Replies button, use this method instead.

steps.title: Turn on Send automatic replies.
steps.content: Turn on Send automatic replies . This is the second radio button at the top of the Automatic Replies window. Once you enable this feature, you'll be able to fill out the rest of the details in the window. If you're on an Exchange server, you'll see two tabs on this window: Inside My Organization and Outside My Organization . By default, your automatic Out of Office replies will only be sent to people within your organization.

steps.title: Choose when to send automatic Out of Office replies.
steps.content: Choose when to send automatic Out of Office replies. Once you turn on this feature, Outlook will automatically send your Out of Office message in response to all email messages you receive. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you want Outlook to automatically send your Out of Office response between two specific dates and times, check the box next to "Only send during this time range" and choose your time period. For example, if you plan on going on vacation for two weeks, select the date range during which you'll be on vacation so the automatic response will only be active while you're out. If you want to turn on Out of Office now and leave it on until you manually turn it off, don’t tick the box.

steps.title: Create your automatic reply.
steps.content: Create your automatic reply. Now, you can compose the automatic response that Outlook will send to anyone who writes while you're away. If you're on an Exchange server, you'll see two tabs in this window below the dates and times: Inside My Organization and Outside My Organization . Click the Inside My Organization tab and type an Out of Office message for people within your company or organization on this tab. If the only tab you see is Automatic replies , just create your Out of Office reply on this tab. In this case, automatic replies will be sent to everyone who writes you while Automatic Replies is enabled. For example, type a message explaining the dates you'll be unavailable, and refer questions and concerns to another contact in your office. You may also want to allow a coworker or assistant to send emails on your behalf while you're out of the office.

steps.title: Select your Outside My Organization preferences.
steps.content: Select your Outside My Organization preferences. If you don't see this tab, you can skip this step. If you're on an Exchange server, you can further customize your automatic replies by creating a different message or rules for emails sent by people outside of your company or organization. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source By default, the automatic reply you enter into this field will be sent all senders outside of your organization, including advertisers, newsletter senders, and even possibly spammers. To avoid sending your vacation message to people you don't already associate with, consider turning on the My contacts only option instead.

steps.title: Click OK to save your changes.
steps.content: Click OK to save your changes. If you didn't select specific dates for your automatic replies, the feature will activate immediately. If you did choose specific dates, your automatic replies will turn on and off automatically at the times you specified. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click New Email to compose a new message.
steps.content: Click New Email to compose a new message. If your version of Outlook doesn't have the option to create automatic replies while you're out of the office, you can still set up your vacation message by creating an Out of Office template and applying rules. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Start by creating a new email message for your template. Rules can also be used to keep your inbox organized.

steps.title: Type a subject and body for your Out of Office message.
steps.content: Type a subject and body for your Out of Office message. You'll leave the "To" and "CC" fields blank, as you won't actually be sending this message. In the subject line, type the subject you want to appear in each message sent in your Out of Office replies. For example, "Out of Office," or "On vacation until 9/22." In the body of the message, you'll usually want to list the dates you'll be out of the office, and any specific instructions the sender should follow in the meantime. You may also include the contact information for somebody else within your organization in case the sender needs immediate assistance.

steps.title: Click the File menu and choose Save as.
steps.content: Click the File menu and choose Save as . Although you created an email message, you'll be saving it as a template instead of sending it. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Choose Outlook template (*.oft) as the file type and click Save.
steps.content: Choose Outlook template (*.oft) as the file type and click Save . This saves your template in the default location, which is usually c:\users\yourusername\appdata\roaming\microsoft\templates .

steps.title: Click the File tab and select Manage Rules & Alerts.
steps.content: Click the File tab and select Manage Rules & Alerts . To ensure your Out of Office message is sent automatically, you'll need to create a rule that tells Outlook when to send the message. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the New Rule button.
steps.content: Click the New Rule button. You'll see this under the Email Rules tab. A Rule Wizard dialog box will pop up to walk you through creating a rule. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click to select "Apply rules on messages I receive."
steps.content: Click to select "Apply rules on messages I receive." You'll see this under the “Start from a blank rule" header.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . Another screen of options will appear.

steps.title: Click Next to proceed to creating the rule.
steps.content: Click Next to proceed to creating the rule. Although there are several options on the screen, you'll want to click Next to proceed to the next screen without making any selections. You'll then see a pop-up saying, "This rule will be applied to every message you receive. Is this correct?" Click Next when you see the pop-up message to continue.

steps.title: Tick the box next to "reply using a specific template."
steps.content: Tick the box next to "reply using a specific template." You'll see this under the header “What do you want to do with the message?"

steps.title: Click the "a specific template” link.
steps.content: Click the "a specific template” link. You'll see this at the bottom of the window under "Step 2." [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select User Templates in File System from the “Look In” dropdown menu.
steps.content: Select User Templates in File System from the “Look In” dropdown menu. This is the menu at the top of the window.

steps.title: Select your template and click Open.
steps.content: Select your template and click Open . This is the email template you created earlier.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next .

steps.title: Choose any exceptions and click Next.
steps.content: Choose any exceptions and click Next . For example, if you don't want your vacation message to be sent to specific people, you can select "except if from people or public group," then select a sender.

steps.title: Name and enable your rule.
steps.content: Name and enable your rule. Type a name for your rule, such as "Out of Office." You can also choose whether to turn your rule on now or wait until you leave the office. By default, you'll see that "Turn on this rule" is selected. This means that once you proceed to the next step, your Out of Office status will start automatically and remain on until you turn it off. If you don't want to turn on the feature yet, remove the checkmark from the box—you can return to this screen later to turn it on.

steps.title: Click Finish to save your changes.
steps.content: Click Finish to save your changes. Once the rule is enabled, anyone who emails you will receive your Out of Office message. [10] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you're not turning on the rule now, you can turn it on later by returning to File > Manage Rules & Alerts > E-mail Rules , checking the box next to the rule, and clicking OK . To turn off your rule when you return, go to File > Manage Rules & Alerts > E-mail Rules , select the rule, and click Delete .

steps.title: Sign in to your email account at https://www.outlook.com.
steps.content: Sign in to your email account at https://www.outlook.com . Or, if your business or organization uses Outlook 365 on the web, sign in to your work's email server in your web browser now. This method will also work for free Outlook.com & Hotmail.com email accounts.

steps.title: Click the gear icon.
steps.content: Click the gear icon. You'll see it at the top-right corner of Outlook.

steps.title: Click the Account tab.
steps.content: Click the Account tab. It's in the left panel of your settings.

steps.title: Click Automatic replies.
steps.content: Click Automatic replies . It's in the center column.

steps.title: Enable "Turn on automatic replies" .
steps.content: Enable "Turn on automatic replies" . When you click the switch, the text will change to "Automatic replies on." This enables your automatic vacation responder. [11] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Choose when to send your Out of Office message.
steps.content: Choose when to send your Out of Office message. If you only want your vacation message to be sent during specific dates and times, check the box next to "Send replies only during a time period," then choose the proper dates and times. To enable the feature now and leave it on until you turn it off, don't check the box.

steps.title: Type your Out of Office reply.
steps.content: Type your Out of Office reply. The message you type into the box will be sent in response to all email messages while you're out of the office. You can use any of the font and layout features to spruce up your message. If you're using Outlook 365 on the web through your organization's email server, you'll also have these options, which you can enable if you'd like: Block my calendar for this period Automatically decline new invitations for events that occur during this period Decline and cancel my meetings during this period

steps.title: Choose who should receive the message.
steps.content: Choose who should receive the message. If you're using your organization's email server, you'll have the option to Send replies outside your organization , which ensures that your automatic reply is sent to people outside of your company. This option does not appear for everyone. If you don't see this option, you can opt to enable Send replies only to contacts to avoid sending automatic replies to advertisers, newsletters, and even spammers.

steps.title: Click Save to save your changes.
steps.content: Click Save to save your changes. If you chose a specific time period, your Out of Office replies will be sent during the time period you selected. If not, your automatic replies will begin immediately. [12] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To turn off automatic replies if you didn't choose an end date, return to the gear icon, select View all Outlook settings > Mail > Automatic replies , then toggle off the feature.

steps.title: Open New Outlook for Windows.
steps.content: Open New Outlook for Windows. If you're using the newest version of Microsoft Outlook, you can use this method to create an automatic Out of Office reply. You'll know you're in New Outlook if you see a switch at the top-right corner that says "New Outlook."

steps.title: Click the gear icon.
steps.content: Click the gear icon. You'll see it at the top-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Automatic replies.
steps.content: Click Automatic replies . It's in the center column of your settings.

steps.title: Toggle on "Turn on automatic replies."
steps.content: Toggle on "Turn on automatic replies." Now, you can choose your preferences for your OOO message.

steps.title: Customize your message.
steps.content: Customize your message. Check the box next to "Send replies only during a time period" if you want your Out of Office message to begin and end on specific dates, then choose your start and end dates. If you want to enable the feature now and disable it manually later, leave the box unchecked. Type your preferred Out of Office message. For example, you may want to include the email address or phone number of someone filling in for you while you're gone. If you'd like, you can check the box next to "Send replies only to contacts" if you only want your OOO message to be sent to people already saved to your contacts.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your Out of Office message is now active. To manually disable your Out of Office message, return here and toggle off "Automatic replies on."

steps.title: Click the Tools menu in Outlook for Mac.
steps.content: Click the Tools menu in Outlook for Mac. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Automatic Replies….
steps.content: Click Automatic Replies… . The Automatic Replies window will appear. [13] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enable "Send automatic replies for account."
steps.content: Enable "Send automatic replies for account." Checking this box is how you can toggle your Out of Office message on and off as needed.

steps.title: Enter the contents of your Out of Office message.
steps.content: Enter the contents of your Out of Office message. Type what you'd like senders to receive into the "Reply once to each sender within my organization" box. Anything you type into the box will be sent to those who email you while the message is active. If you use Outlook at work or school, your admin may have enabled the ability to "Send replies outside my organization." If you want to send a different response to people outside your company or school, check the box, and choose who you want to send the message to. [14] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You can enter different messages into each box if you'd like.

steps.title: Choose a time period (optional).
steps.content: Choose a time period (optional). If you want your autoresponder to turn on and off automatically, you can check the box next to "Send replies only during this time period," then choose your start and end times.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . If you did not select specific start and end times, your vacation message will now be active. Otherwise, it will activate automatically at the designated time. You can turn off your auto-reply at any time by returning to this window and unchecking "Send automatic replies for an account."

steps.title: Click Out of Office Assistant in the Tools tab.
steps.content: Click Out of Office Assistant in the Tools tab. You'll find the Tools tab in the menu along the top left of the program window. The Out of Office Assistant dialog box will open. If this option is not available, you may be using a non-Exchange account.

steps.title: Click to select the circle next to “Send Out of Office auto-replies.
steps.content: Click to select the circle next to “Send Out of Office auto-replies. ” If you want to specify a time, click to select the box next to “Only send during this time range,” then select a start time and end time. For example, if you plan on going on vacation for two weeks, select the date range during which you'll be on vacation so the automatic response will only be active while you're out.

steps.title: Click the Inside my organization tab.
steps.content: Click the Inside my organization tab. You'll see this above the large, blank text box.

steps.title: Type the automatic reply you want to be sent to people who email you from your office or company.
steps.content: Type the automatic reply you want to be sent to people who email you from your office or company. Only the addresses from the same domain (@wikiHow.com) will get the message you type here. For example, explain that you'll be out of the office for the day and that your manager will be responsible for your duties while you're gone.

steps.title: Click the Outside my organization tab.
steps.content: Click the Outside my organization tab. You'll see this above the large, blank text box.

steps.title: Type the automatic reply you want to be sent to people who email you from outside your organization.
steps.content: Type the automatic reply you want to be sent to people who email you from outside your organization. For example, type a message explaining that you're unavailable, and refer questions and concerns to another contact from your office. Only emails sent from outside your domain (@wikiHow.com) will see the message you write here. There is a drop-down for font type and font size, as well as buttons to format the text in your message.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Individuals who email you while you're out of the office will receive the automatic replies you created. If you did not select a time range, the automatic response will send until you turn off the feature. [15] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
